Posts.Content: On Feb 21, 2014 6:59 PM EmilyH wrote: Hi. My name is Emily and my best friend was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic breast cancer last July that had spread to her bones.  She went through 6 rounds of chemo every 3 weeks and the PET scan showed no cancer! YAY!  She had a double mastectomy and partial hysterectomy (some of the tumors were estrogen-fed) on Jan 13 2014.  She went in for a body scan a few weeks later and they found more cancer under her arm.  They told her they would resume chemo followed with radiation for her bones.   Two weeks ago she went to the ER with severe headaches and back pain.  CT scan showed no cancer in the brain or vital organs.  They put her on pain meds, released.  Several days later she went back for severe headaches, loss of vision.  They did a spinal tap and her spinal pressure was very high and they removed 11 cc of fluid.  They also resumed chemo that day as her oncologist said that it was very important to jump on this NOW. We are supposed to find out if there are cancer cells in her spinal fluid today. I don't even know if I have a question.  We are both 35 - have been inseperable since we were in kindergarten.  Our children are close friends.  She has an 8 year old and a 6 year old.  I don't want to lose her.   I guess since I need a question... can anyone tell me a reason why her spinal pressure would be so high for a reason other than cancer?  Is there any hope?  Everything I have read says once it gets in the spinal fluid prognosis is grim. This sucks. -Emily God is in control.  I'm a BC survivor for ten years recently I have bone mets and in my spine and liver. I still work full time and have been on chemo.  Chemo combinations are not working now.  But I know he is in control.  I never wanted to share my story to anyone.  But I know that I am able to stay alive only because HE Lives and prayers.  My doctors are still optimistic and I manage with a healthy diet, juicing and eating one healthy meal. I'm glad she has a friend like you.  That is all she needs someone to talk to and pray with her. There has to be a cure.  I'm still searching and am hopeful
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.
